speaker: Viral image
vclaim: The picture shows a man holding a woman's ass watching the launch of Apollo 8 in 1968.
date: stated on October 22, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, this isn't a real picture of a couple watching the Apollo 8 launch.
text: Apollo 8 was the first cosmic spacecraft to successfully orbit the moon and return to Earth, and one man saw history making sense. This is what you think a picture is shared on Facebook. "A couple watching the launch of the Apollo 8, 1968," they read an article 22 October showing a picture of a man and woman watching a spacecraft take off while holding its ass. This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The commentators were joking - "His hands have reached the moon" - but at least one of the novels questioned the authenticity of the picture. "Fake"? Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in the Facebook newspaper Nancy Belusi, who was no longer Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman: January 12, 2021. The original picture shows that the H-2A rocket was launched in Tanegashima, Japan, in May 2000 - not the Apollo 8. (You can see the Apollo 8 release photos here.) These couples are nowhere in the picture. Snoops checked similar social media releases in June and found a different picture with the couple. This picture shows the husband standing in front of Victor Vasentov's painting "Evan Tsarevich riding the grey wolf" at the Tritiakov exhibition in Russia. The photo appeared on the Internet early in 2016 and many articles on the Internet define Andre Struganov as the photographer. We're assessing this wrong Facebook post.
